If you don’t like someone, make sure it’s because they did something directly to you.

Russell was denied the honor because he started the season late after the 1956 Olympics and played 48 games. Heinsohn said Russell always told him he still owed him $150 because Heinsohn should have split the $300 first prize.

Some things you may not have known about Bill Russell from my NBA history book, Hard Labor: 

— Russell was not Rookie of the Year in 1957 when he led the Celtics to their first NBA title. Tom Heinsohn was R0Y when Russell led the league averaging 19.6 rebounds.

— Russell and his Black teammates were denied seating in a restaurant in Marion, Ind. before a preseason game after each member of the team was awarded a key to city upon arrival. Russell, Sam Jones and K.C. Jones went to the house of the mayor to return their keys.

— In Wilt’s first game against Russell, Russell led Boston to the win with 22 points and 35 rebounds. Wilt had 30 and 28. In their second game, Wilt’s Philadelphia Warriors won Game 2 as Wilt had 45 points and 35 rebounds.

— Russell and Wilt had a falling out after the 1969 Finals and Russell’s last game when the Celtics beat Wilt’s Lakers in Game 7. Russell was quoted claiming Wilt quit in the game. They didn’t speak for almost 30 years, but reconciled before Wilt’s sudden death in 1999.
— Russell once owned a rubber farm in Liberia and considered retiring there.

Havlicek later asked Russell why he said no. “I’m not a basketball player,” Russell replied. “I’m a man who plays basketball.”

Bill Russell. The game's greatest winner. RIP
— Considered the first (and perhaps only) superstar who didn’t need the ball, Russell walking with John Havlicek once was stopped by a woman who asked if he was a basketball player. Russell said no.

— The game’s greatest rivalry to this day remains Russell and Wilt Chamberlain. Renowned 76ers statistician Harvey Pollack calculated the rivalry 88-74 to Russell head to head. Chamberlain averaged 28.7 points and 28.7 rebounds; Russell averaged 23.7 points and 14.5 rebounds.

“Change the world by your example, not your opinion.”

| Paulo Coelho
